sentences.english: Blocking the quorum sensing system would be equivalent to using white noise to interfere with spoken communication, Blackwell adds.
sentences.chinese: 干扰群体感应系统就相当于用白噪音去阻扰口头通讯。

sentences.english: And the conclusion is that the change of impedance of electric load will make resonant frequency changing.
sentences.chinese: 电负载的阻扰改变将引起振子共振频率的改变。

sentences.english: He has made some attempts, only to be stonewalled by the Republicans.
sentences.chinese: 他做出过一些尝试，但是都受到了共和党的阻扰。

sentences.english: So the Republican plan is to delay and disrupt reform.
sentences.chinese: 因此，共和党的计划是拖延并阻扰改革的进行。

sentences.english: We need to foul one of their guys in order to stop the clock.
sentences.chinese: 为了延缓比赛我们需要犯规阻扰对方的一名队员。

definition: forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
to be hard on sb/to deliberately make things difficult
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
